DataElement.preferredName: Seizure Disease Present ICANS Seizure Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the ICANS seizure grade.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of seizure, a sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin, that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the most dramatic type of seizure, characterized by tonic and clonic contraction of most skeletal muscles.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome Seizure Grade
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Neurotoxicity associated with immune effector cell therapy. It may be characterized by aphasia, altered level of consciousness, motor weakness, seizures, and cerebral edema._Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Life-threatening prolonged seizure (>5 min); or repetitive clinical or electrical seizures without return to baseline in between seizures, as defined by the American Society for Transplantation and Cellular Therapy (ASTCT) and the Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome (ICANS) Consensus Grading for Adults.

Concepts.definition: Life-threatening prolonged seizure (>5 min); or repetitive clinical or electrical seizures without return to baseline in between seizures, as defined by the American Society for Transplantation and Cellular Therapy (ASTCT) and the Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome (ICANS) Consensus Grading for Adults.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any clinical seizure focal or generalized that resolves rapidly or nonconvulsive seizures on EEG that resolve with intervention, as defined by the American Society for Transplantation and Cellular Therapy (ASTCT) and the Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome (ICANS) Consensus Grading for Adults.

Concepts.definition: Any clinical seizure focal or generalized that resolves rapidly or nonconvulsive seizures on EEG that resolve with intervention, as defined by the American Society for Transplantation and Cellular Therapy (ASTCT) and the Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome (ICANS) Consensus Grading for Adults.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome Seizure Grade
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Neurotoxicity associated with immune effector cell therapy. It may be characterized by aphasia, altered level of consciousness, motor weakness, seizures, and cerebral edema.:Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.:A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.longName: Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome
Concepts.definition: Neurotoxicity associated with immune effector cell therapy. It may be characterized by aphasia, altered level of consciousness, motor weakness, seizures, and cerebral edema.
Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.
A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.
